page.title: 05Landscape/Bldngs, Flintham.
page.content: The{Main St.}was designated a{conser- {vation area}some years ago. Most of the houses are brick with pantile or slate roofs, the majority dating to the C18th, built either sideways to the street or directly onto the road. There is a small complex on Woods Lane of "executive" houses built in the 1970's not visible from the Main St. There are three farms in the village and four council houses on Inholms Rd. {Flintham Hall,}a listed building, has a famous{conservatory}built by Hine. There is a church, a chapel and school the latter built in the 1960's. The Old School is used by the village after 3.30 as a village hall. The Main Street looks the same as it did over a hundred years ago, and is a most attractive village to live in. Despite planning restrictions most villagers wouldn't change the looks of Flintham.
